sentence.text: However , he was hounded all the way by Phillip McCallen who put on his best performance of the day so far .

He claimed that his Socialist opponents had used corruption allegations to hound him from office , and that fellow right-wing politicians in Paris had abandoned him ( many of Médecin 's close political friends had been alienated by his decision in 1989 to leave the Gaullist Rally for the Republic and join the far right National Centre of Independents and Peasants ) .
And this time China 's rulers knifed it in the back with shameless savagery -- then set about hounding the survivors in a reign of terror .
Between them , Candy and Adam had hounded her into a corner ; she felt beleaguered , under attack from all sides .
The grieving widow was rich and powerful enough to hound anyone through the courts .
And you hounded him at work , wanting his attention all the time like a spoilt child .
And I think they 'd just been hounding him for a while and that was the last straw .
Why was he hounding her like this ?
Dinah felt herself trembling ; this was the man who had libelled Paul and herself , had made their early years wretched , had hounded her out of the only world she knew .
Your lawyers told me that we 've been lucky the press have n't hounded us out of the house yet .
But her screams still echoed in his ears , ringing out into the night , summoning all his enemies , the whole world , who only wanted this opportunity to hound him , to tear him .
With his kinsmen and the Godwin family hounding him , and Mercia threatening to overwhelm him , he had to extend north , or else clear his rivals out of Northumbria .
THE parents of zany comedian Vic Reeves yesterday denied they had put their house on the market to stop fans hounding them .
You really think it 's the police who 've been hounding us ?
Here at least she would not be hounded by her other creditors .
In an embittered speech , Shevardnadze complained that he had been hounded by reactionary political opponents .
Local traders complain the Wales 's were once a familiar sight but have been hounded off the streets by pressmen .
I was hounded out .
For this he was hounded into the political wilderness ; but now it is happening .

In my opinion , they should stop hounding law-abiding citizens and set about catching the obvious culprits , whoever they are .
Far from hounding him gratuitously , they said , they were acting on information received .
She blabbed to the Press and they hounded me until I left the country .

Deprived of royal favour , and hounded from Radnorshire politics by his great rivals the Harleys , he sought out a new patron , Thomas Grey , second Earl of Stamford [ q.v. ] , a new parliamentary seat ( first for Breconshire and then as Stamford 's nominee for Bere Alston ) , and a new reputation as an energetic House of Commons man .
Was he hounded to death ?
When he is eventually hounded out of America and into exile by J Edgar Hoover ( Kevin Dunn ) it is an ignominious end to his career .
He and his friends would have me scoffed and hounded out of the county rather than see my house completed .
I 'd seen other men in other companies , as innocent as I believed myself to be , hounded out because wrongdoers require a scapegoat where the wrongdoing concerns money .
It was to hound and hasten Leonard 's waking thoughts , eliminate any residual interest he may have possessed in mere intellectual commitment , and open to him the stark reality of life downtown .
